title: ChromaticRegistrationEvaluation
description: According to ISO 21073:2019, co-registration accuracy measures the capacity of a microscope system to image a fluorescent object with different excitation and emission Wavelengths at the same position in the Image. Hence, the spatial distance of the Image positions of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) located in the centre of the Field of View (FOV) for different excitation and detection Wavelength bands is denoted as co-registration accuracy. The co-registration accuracy shall be calculated from the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of the Point-like object for the different Wavelengths. The lateral co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆lateral = √(xλ1 - xλ2)^2 + (yλ1 - yλ2)^2; and the axial co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆axial = √(zλ1 - zλ2)^2. This element refers to the results of a specific Co-registration Accuracy evaluation assay associated with this Optical Calibration procedure.

subCategoriesOrder.ChromaticRegistrationEvaluation: According to ISO 21073:2019, co-registration accuracy measures the capacity of a microscope system to image a fluorescent object with different excitation and emission Wavelengths at the same position in the Image. Hence, the spatial distance of the Image positions of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) located in the centre of the Field of View (FOV) for different excitation and detection Wavelength bands is denoted as co-registration accuracy. The co-registration accuracy shall be calculated from the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of the Point-like object for the different Wavelengths. The lateral co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆lateral = √(xλ1 - xλ2)^2 + (yλ1 - yλ2)^2; and the axial co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆axial = √(zλ1 - zλ2)^2. This element refers to the results of a specific Co-registration Accuracy evaluation assay associated with this Optical Calibration procedure.

ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this component.

ReferenceWavelength.description: This field captures the Wavelength of the Reference Channel against which the Chromatic Registration Accuracy is being calculated in this procedure.

TestWavelength.description: This field captures the Wavelength of the Test Channel whose Chromatic Registration Accuracy is being calculated in this procedure.

XChromaticShift_RT.description: This field captures the offset in the the observed X-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Reference vs. the Test Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλT - xλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

YChromaticShift_RT.description: This field captures the offset in the the observed Y-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Reference vs. the Test Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλT - xλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

XChromaticShift_TR.description: This field captures the offset in the the observed X-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Test vs. the Reference Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλR - xλT)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

YChromaticShift_TR.description: This field captures the offset in the the observed Y-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Test vs. the Reference Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλR - xλT)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

AxialChromaticShift_RT.description: This field captures the offset in the the observed Z-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Reference vs. the Test Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(zλT - zλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

AxialChromaticShift_TR.description: This field captures the offset in the the observed Z-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Test vs. the Reference Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(zλT - zλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
